title: How to write 6,000 million in a letter - Quora

response.answer_text: You have a few options available to you: 6B (as in “six-billion”— this is common is the U.S., although in the U.K., a billion is actually the equivalent of the U.S.’s “trillion”).Six-billion (again, appropriate to the U.S., though perhaps not the U.K.)Six-thousand-million (appropriate to the U.K., confusing to people in the U.S.).If you don’t mind being obscure, you could always write 6(10 to the 12th power) (sorry, quora won’t permit me to type in super-script…), or six times ten to the twelfth power. I hope this helps…

Let me tell you with reference to Indian Monetary system:- 1 Million. =10 Lakh 10 Millions =1 Crore 100 Millions =10 Crores 1000 Millions =100 Crores/1 Billion. Since it's 6000 Millions, So:- 1000 Millions×6= 6000 Millions= 600 Crores or 6Billions.. Now You must write 6(Six) Billions instead of 6000 Millions.
